@graph.title: Yeats's legacies
abstract: Emily C. Bloom, The Wireless Past: Anglo-Irish Writers and the BBC, 1931-1968 (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2016),  pp. 224. Contents -- List of Illustrations -- Abbreviations -- Editorial Board -- Notes on the Contributors -- Introduction -- Acknowledgements and Editorial Information -- ESSAYS -- How Yeats Learned to Scan -- EASTER 1916 -- The Invisible Hypnotist: Myth and Spectre in Some Post-1916 Poems and Plays by W. B. Yeats -- 'Satan Smut & Co': Yeats and the Suppression of Evil Literature in the Early Years of the Free State -- 'Uttering, Mastering it'? Yeats and the Problem of Belief -- Charles Williams and W. B. Yeats -- Shakespeare in Purgatory: 'A Scene of Tragic Intensity' -- The Textual History of Yeats's On the Boiler -- RESEARCH UPDATES -- Maud Gonne's Fictional Affair: 'A Life's Sketch' -- Conflicted Legacies: Yeats's Intentions and Editorial Theory -- REVIEW ESSAYS AND REVIEWS -- 'Both Beautiful, One a Gazelle': A Review Essay -- W.
